items.standfirst: The US government began shutting down after midnight on Wednesday after Congress failed to agree a stopgap budget, halting operations at federal agencies and sidelining hundreds of thousands of workers. In exchange for their votes, Democrats had demanded billions of dollars in healthcare spending be restored, particularly for low-income households.

In exchange for their votes, Democrats had demanded billions of dollars in healthcare spending be restored, particularly for low-income households.

items.standfirst: The US government began shutting down Wednesday after lawmakers and President Donald Trump failed to break a budget impasse during acrimonious talks that hinged on Democratic demands for health care funding. Republicans and Democrats immediately blamed each other for the deadlock that will impact hundreds of thousands of government workers and the millions of Americans who use the services they provide.

items.title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
items.standfirst: First shutdown in nearly seven years as Republicans accused of ‚Äòrisking America‚Äôs healthcare‚Äô in spending billUS government shutdown ‚Äì live updatesThe US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.The GOP, which controls the Senate and the House of Representatives, repudiated their demands, setting off a legislative scramble that lasted into the hours before funding lapsed at midnight, when the Senate failed to advance both parties‚Äô bills to keep funding going. items.title: US governement shutdown: 'This all comes down to health care'
items.standfirst: The US government began shutting down Wednesday after lawmakers and President Donald Trump failed to break a budget impasse during acrimonious talks that hinged on Democratic demands for health care funding. "This all effectively comes down to healthcare ‚Äì the sticking point that democrats refused to budge on and that Republicans said must be handled separately", said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Washington Fraser Jackson.
items.content: The US government began shutting down Wednesday after lawmakers and President Donald Trump failed to break a budget impasse during acrimonious talks that hinged on Democratic demands for health care funding. "This all effectively comes down to healthcare ‚Äì the sticking point that democrats refused to budge on and that Republicans said must be handled separately", said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Washington Fraser Jackson.

items.title: US government shuts down as lawmakers fail to break funding deadlock
items.standfirst: The US government began shutting down after midnight Wednesday as President Donald Trump and lawmakers failed to resolve a budget impasse centered on health care funding. It is the first shutdown in nearly seven years, halting operations at multiple federal agencies and sidelining hundreds of thousands of workers.
items.content: The US government began shutting down after midnight Wednesday as President Donald Trump and lawmakers failed to resolve a budget impasse centered on health care funding. It is the first shutdown in nearly seven years, halting operations at multiple federal agencies and sidelining hundreds of thousands of workers.

How government shutdown could impact the economy
items.standfirst: For the first time since 2018, an impasse on federal spending shut down the government at midnight. The Congressional Budget Office estimates over 750,000 workers will be furloughed. Caitlin Huey-Burns reports the impact will ripple across the U.S. economy.
items.content: For the first time since 2018, an impasse on federal spending shut down the government at midnight. The Congressional Budget Office estimates over 750,000 workers will be furloughed. Caitlin Huey-Burns reports the impact will ripple across the U.S. economy.

The shutdown is expected to be worse than previous ones, potentially impacting federal workers.

President Trump announced a pricing deal with Pfizer before the government shutdown.

clusters.title: At least 69 people killed in a powerful earthquake that hit the Philippines
clusters.neutral_headline: Powerful Earthquake Hits Philippines, Killing Dozens

items.title: At least 69 people killed in a powerful earthquake that hit the Philippines
items.standfirst: At least 69 people were killed in a powerful earthquake that hit a central Philippine province where dozens of peple were killed by a powerful earthquake Tuesday night. The magnitude-6.9 earthquake that hit at about 10 p.m. trapped an unspecified number of residents in collapsed houses, nightclubs and other businesses in the hard-hit city of Bogo and outlying rural towns in Cebu province, officials said.
items.content: At least 69 people were killed in a powerful earthquake that hit a central Philippine province where dozens of peple were killed by a powerful earthquake Tuesday night. The magnitude-6.9 earthquake that hit at about 10 p.m. trapped an unspecified number of residents in collapsed houses, nightclubs and other businesses in the hard-hit city of Bogo and outlying rural towns in Cebu province, officials said.

items.title: Indonesia school collapse: 91 missing and three dead as rescuers search rubble for second day
items.standfirst: Desperate search for more than 90 missing after building collapses while students held prayers at school in SidoarjoParents and rescuers in Indonesia were desperately searching for dozens of teenage boys believed to be trapped, a day after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school which has already left three dead, authorities said.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing after the Al Khoziny school building collapsed while pupils held late afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. items.title: Oktoberfest temporarily closed due to bomb threat after deadly explosion in Munich
items.standfirst: Police temporarily closed the famed Oktoberfest beer festival in Munich on Wednesday in response to a bomb threat. Authorities said they were investigating how the threat may be connected to an explosion at a residential building earlier in the day that killed at least one person.

items.content: Hamas said Tuesday it will discuss U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs peace plan for Gaza within the militant group and with other Palestinian factions before responding. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has already thrown his support behind it, but it‚Äôs unclear whether Hamas will agree, or when it will give a response.
